snippet: Hamas has sought new support from Sunni governments like Qatar and the United Arab Emirates, but it has also raised taxes and fees considerably, prompting complaints from Gazans.
abstract: Hamas is seeking new support from Sunni governments like Qatar and the United Arab Emirates, due to financial troubles stemming from revolt in Syria, its expanding military ambitions, increasing demands from Gaza's impoverished population, as well as loss of backing from Syria and Iran; has also raised taxes considerably, prompting complaints from Gazans.
lead_paragraph: Hamas has sought new support from Sunni governments like Qatar and the United Arab Emirates, but it has also raised taxes and fees considerably, prompting complaints from Gazans.

headline.seo: Money Woes Could Erode High Hamas Standing in Gaza
headline.main: Hamas Gains Allure in Gaza, but Money Is a Problem
headline.print_headline: Hamas Gains Allure in Gaza, But Money Is a Problem

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
